lines.gurmukhi: AwNDry kau sbd suriq kr cr tyk AMD guMg sbd suriq kr cr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Aandharay Kau Sabad Surati Kar Char Tayka , Andh Goung Sabad Surati Kar Char Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: A blind person has the-support of power of speech, hands and feet. And if someone is blind and dumb as well, then he is dependent on others for listening power, hands and feet.

lines.gurmukhi: AMD guMg suMn kr cr AvlMb tyk AMD guMg suMn pMg tyk eyk kr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Andh Goung Sounn Kar Char Avalanb Tayka , Andh Goung Sounn Pang Tayk Ayk Kar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: If someone is blind, deaf and dumb, he has support of hands and feet. But if one is blind, deaf, dumb and lame, he has support only of hands.

lines.gurmukhi: AMD guMg suMn pMg luMj duK puMj mm srbMg hIn dIn duKq ADr hY
lines.transliteration_english: Andh Goung Sounn Pang Lounj Doukh Pounj Mama , Sarabang Heen Deen Doukhat Adhar Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: But I am a bundle of pains and sufferings, because I am blind, deaf, dumb, crippled and have no support. I am deeply distressed.

lines.gurmukhi: AMqr kI AMqrjwmI jwnY AMqrgiq kYsy inrbwhu krY srY nrhr hY ]315]
lines.transliteration_english: Antar Kee Antarajaamee Jaanai Antaragati , Kaisay Nirabaahu Karai Sarai Narahar Hai ?315?

Shabad OS B.translation: Oh Omnipotent Lord! You are Omniscient. How can I tell you my pain, how will I live and how will I cross this worldly ocean of life. (315)
